item.title: Migrating from Terminator to Kitty
item.description: Daniel Lipovetsky’s Typometer results. Ever since I first learned about Terminator I’ve been a huge fan! It’s a great replacement for the standard Gnome terminal with its built-in support for horizontal and vertical splits. It’s not a race car though … like Gnome terminal it’s built around libvte. So on a bad day of clashing with Ubuntu, GDM, systemd and the new handling of capabilities, two of my colleagues went all-in on Alacritty and now swear by it!
